thread.title: St. Bernard Parish rolls out new buses
thread.title_full: St. Bernard Parish rolls out new buses - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: St. Bernard Parish rolls out new buses
text:
ST. BERNARD PARISH, LA (WVUE) - Shiny new buses are rolling in St. Bernard Parish. Transit officials say the new blue buses can hold more passengers, are more durable and are able to serve the disabled population.
"The new buses are fully compliant with ADA regulations and represent a major upgrade to our transportation system," St. Bernard Transit Director Michael Bayham said.
The parish rolled out the new blue bus last week. It is one of several new buses that will replace the existing ones currently on the road. Transit officials say the new buses have 28 seats, a wheelchair lift and have an internal camera system to enhance the safety of the driver and passengers.
The buses run from 5:55 a.m. until 7:49 p.m. The route runs from Torres Street in Poydras to Mehle Street in Arabi. Bus fare is $1 each way.
